main event: A visual observation of a single unidentified object in Springfield & Fayetteville, Ohio on August 27, 1959.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for only 3-4 seconds., The object disappeared similarly to a meteor but was not as fast., The object was described as round and blue in color at about 600 feet away., The object was estimated to be 70-80 feet in diameter., The witness noted that there was no sound associated with the sighting.
witness description: The witness was a fireman and manager of a water plant, aged 25.
